results.title: The effects of age and renal impairment on the pharmacokinetics of co-administered lisinopril and hydrochlorothiazide.
results.text_hl: The pharmacokinetics of combined @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Hydrochlorothiazide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D006852 @@@hydrochlorothiazide@@@ have been studied following single and multiple oral doses to 'young' (reference), elderly and @<m>DISEASE_Hypertension_Renal</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006977 @@@renally impaired hypertensive@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@.

citations.NLM: Laher MS, Mulkerrins E, Hosie J, Connell PA, Smith RP, Swaisland AJ. The effects of age and renal impairment on the pharmacokinetics of co-administered lisinopril and hydrochlorothiazide. J Hum Hypertens. 1991 Dec;5 Suppl 2():77-84. PMID: 1665183
citations.BibTeX: @article{1665183, title={The effects of age and renal impairment on the pharmacokinetics of co-administered lisinopril and hydrochlorothiazide.}, author={Laher MS and Mulkerrins E and Hosie J and Connell PA and Smith RP and Swaisland AJ}, journal={J Hum Hypertens}, volume={5 Suppl 2}, pages={77-84}}

results.title: Lisinopril attenuates renal oxidative injury in L-NAME-induced hypertensive rats.
results.text_hl: These results suggest that @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ could diminish biochemical alterations in @CHEMICAL_NG_Nitroarginine_Methyl_Ester @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019331 @@@L: -NAME@@@ induced @<m>DISEASE_Hypertension_Renal</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006977 @@@hypertensive renal damage@@@ that occurs by oxidative stress.

citations.NLM: Oktem F, Kirbas A, Armagan A, Kuybulu AE, Yilmaz HR, Ozguner F, Uz E. Lisinopril attenuates renal oxidative injury in L-NAME-induced hypertensive rats. Mol Cell Biochem. 2011 Jun;352(1-2):247-53. PMID: 21479940
citations.BibTeX: @article{21479940, title={Lisinopril attenuates renal oxidative injury in L-NAME-induced hypertensive rats.}, author={Oktem F and Kirbas A and Armagan A and Kuybulu AE and Yilmaz HR and Ozguner F and Uz E}, journal={Mol Cell Biochem}, volume={352}, number={1-2}, pages={247-53}}

results.title: Therapeutic advantages of angiotensin converting enzyme inhibitors in chronic renal disease.
results.text_hl: ACE inhibitors such as @CHEMICAL_Captopril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002216 @@@captopril@@@, @CHEMICAL_Enalapril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004656 @@@enalapril@@@, @CHEMICAL_alacepril @CHEMICAL_MESH:C046835 @@@alacepril@@@ delapril cilazapril, and @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ were equally effective in reducing blood pressure in multicenter clinical trials focusing on @<m>DISEASE_Hypertension_Renal</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006977 @@@renal hypertension@@@ in Japan.

citations.NLM: Omata K, Kanazawa M, Sato T, Abe F, Saito T, Abe K. Therapeutic advantages of angiotensin converting enzyme inhibitors in chronic renal disease. Kidney Int Suppl. 1996 Jun;55():S57-62. PMID: 8743512
citations.BibTeX: @article{8743512, title={Therapeutic advantages of angiotensin converting enzyme inhibitors in chronic renal disease.}, author={Omata K and Kanazawa M and Sato T and Abe F and Saito T and Abe K}, journal={Kidney Int Suppl}, volume={55}, pages={S57-62}}
